learningLabs.title: Learning Lab: The Trolley Problem in AI Ethics
learningLabs.overview: Explore the classic trolley problem through the lens of modern AI systems and autonomous decision-making. This lab guides you through complex ethical scenarios where AI systems must make life-and-death decisions.
learningObjectives: Understand the ethical implications of programming life-and-death decisions into AI systems
Analyze utilitarian vs. deontological approaches to autonomous vehicle ethics
Evaluate the responsibility and accountability of AI decision-making in critical situations
Develop frameworks for ethical AI decision-making in autonomous systems

phases.name: Foundations & Context
phases.description: Establish understanding of the trolley problem and its relevance to modern AI systems
activities: Review the classic trolley problem thought experiment
Explore real-world applications in autonomous vehicles
Discuss the challenge of programming ethical decisions
Identify key stakeholders in autonomous system ethics
resources: Case studies of autonomous vehicle incidents
deliverables: Initial position on trolley problem scenarios

phases.name: Scenario Deep Dive
phases.description: Engage with multiple trolley problem variants and AI-specific scenarios
activities: Compare decisions across different ethical frameworks
Analyze the implications of programming these decisions

phases.name: Critical Analysis & Debate
phases.description: Critically examine different approaches and engage in structured debate
activities: Debate the programmability of ethical decisions
deliverables: Position paper on preferred ethical approach

phases.name: Synthesis & Future Applications
phases.description: Synthesize learning and apply to broader AI ethics contexts
activities: Develop personal ethical framework for AI
Identify other AI domains with similar dilemmas
Create action plan for ethical AI development
Reflect on learning and perspective changes

criteria.name: Ethical Reasoning Depth
criteria.description: Quality and sophistication of ethical analysis

levels.exemplary: Demonstrates nuanced understanding of multiple ethical frameworks with sophisticated analysis of complex moral trade-offs
levels.proficient: Shows solid grasp of ethical principles with clear reasoning and good consideration of alternatives
levels.developing: Basic understanding of ethics with some logical reasoning but limited depth of analysis
levels.beginning: Superficial treatment of ethical issues with unclear or inconsistent reasoning

criteria.name: Stakeholder Consideration
criteria.description: Recognition and empathetic consideration of affected parties

levels.exemplary: Comprehensive identification of all relevant stakeholders with deep empathetic understanding of diverse perspectives
levels.proficient: Good awareness of multiple stakeholders with thoughtful consideration of their interests and concerns
levels.developing: Some recognition of different stakeholders with basic consideration of their perspectives
levels.beginning: Limited awareness of stakeholders beyond the most obvious ones

criteria.name: Technical Understanding
criteria.description: Grasp of AI systems and programming challenges

levels.exemplary: Sophisticated understanding of AI decision-making processes and programming constraints with innovative solutions
levels.proficient: Solid grasp of AI systems with good understanding of technical implementation challenges
levels.developing: Basic understanding of AI technology with some awareness of programming considerations
levels.beginning: Limited technical understanding with minimal consideration of implementation challenges

levels.exemplary: Exceptional critical analysis with creative insights and well-supported arguments challenging assumptions
levels.proficient: Strong analytical thinking with well-reasoned conclusions and good use of evidence
levels.developing: Basic analysis with some logical reasoning but limited depth or originality
levels.beginning: Weak analytical skills with poor reasoning or unsupported conclusions

preparation: Review all scenario content and ethical frameworks
Prepare discussion prompts for each phase
Set up technology and simulation access
Create diverse student groupings for debates
facilitation: Challenge students to defend their positions with reasoning
Help students connect scenarios to real-world applications

adaptations.largeClass: Use breakout groups and peer teaching strategies
adaptations.mixedAbility: Provide scaffolded worksheets and peer mentoring
adaptations.timeConstrained: Focus on 2-3 key scenarios with abbreviated analysis

discussionQuestions: How should we balance individual rights vs. collective good in AI decision-making?
Who bears responsibility when an autonomous system makes a fatal decision?
Should AI systems be programmed with universal ethical principles or culturally adaptive ones?
How can we ensure transparency in life-critical AI decisions while protecting proprietary algorithms?
What role should public input play in determining how AI systems make ethical decisions?
extensionActivities: Research and analyze real autonomous vehicle accident cases and their ethical implications
Interview automotive engineers or ethicists about programming ethical decisions
Design a public policy proposal for regulating ethical AI in autonomous vehicles
Create a presentation for community stakeholders about AI ethics in transportation
Develop a comparative analysis of how different cultures might approach trolley problem scenarios

crossCurricularConnections.mathematics: Probability analysis in risk assessment and outcome prediction
crossCurricularConnections.socialStudies: Policy development, democratic decision-making, and cultural values
crossCurricularConnections.psychology: Moral development theory and cognitive biases in ethical reasoning
crossCurricularConnections.literature: Exploration of moral dilemmas in literary works and philosophical texts
crossCurricularConnections.science: Understanding of AI technology, sensors, and decision algorithms

assessmentStrategies: Portfolio assessment with scenario responses and reflections
Peer evaluation of ethical reasoning in group discussions
Performance task: Design an ethical decision framework for a specific AI application
Socratic seminar evaluation with focus on questioning and reasoning skills

prerequisites: Familiarity with AI and autonomous systems concepts
